meanings.definition: A woman who is a leader or a prominent figure in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: The panjandra of the science department guided the team to success.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the panjandra of the fashion industry.
meanings.sent3: The panjandra of the bakery always had the best recipes.
meanings.sent4: Her presence at the meeting was like a panjandra overseeing her kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The panjandra's influence on the community was undeniable.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are in charge or have authority over a particular area or organization.
meanings.sent1: The panjandra of the committee made important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The board of directors acted as the panjandra of the company.
meanings.sent3: The panjandra of the book club always picked interesting reads.
meanings.sent4: Their unity created a panjandra that led the project to completion.
meanings.sent5: The panjandra's power was felt throughout the organization.
